etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in The Century Dictionary. From scientific Latin †Palamedeae, use as order name of the plural of Palamedea, genus name (Linnaeus Systema Naturae (ed. 12, 1766) I. 232; from classical Latin Palamēdēs) + -an

definitions: Of or belonging to the group of birds comprising the former genus Palamedea (the screamers, now family Anhimidae).
